H0.text: Chemical change must occur for rust to form when iron combines with water and oxygen over time.

H1.text: Mechanical is the type of change that must occur for rust to form when iron combines with water and oxygen over time.

H2.text: Nuclear is the type of change that must occur for rust to form when iron combines with water and oxygen over time.

H3.text: Physical change is the type of change that must occur for rust to form when iron combines with water and oxygen over time.

A4.text: The rusting of iron is an electrochemical process that begins with the transfer of electrons from iron to oxygen.

A5.text: Rusting is an oxidation reaction specifically occurring with iron.
